source.c08d2bd1:
**IPL FEVER - Player Scouting using Tableau**

![](https://images.financialexpress.com/2017/03/ipl-1.jpg)

For most part, cricket with its complex rules, regulations and different formats, remains a hard sport to understand for most viewers around the world and has evaded the popularity of something like soccer.  

With the advent of T20 cricket, the gentelman's game has been shorted from the gruelling 5 days of Test Cricket to just over 3 hours which results in much closer finishes and entertaining fixtures. The T20 format was originally introduced by the England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) in 2003 for the inter-county competition but it took a bit more than 5 years before the BCCI adopted the same and started its own league - Indian Premier League

The Indian Premier League is the most watched cricket league across the globe and follows a franchise based model where 8 teams, named after different Indian cities, play each other in a home and away round-robin format with the top 4 teams after the league stages competing in the playoffs
source.8b6b44b1:
1. SCOUTING BATSMAN

With the growing T20 leagues across the globe following a franchise based model, player scouting has become a prominent tool to uncover potential players and identify undervalued players

This filters in this Tableau visualization can be adjusted to get data pertaining to player performance during certain overs i.e., Power Play Overs(1-6), the middle overs(7-15) and the slog overs(16-20)

Depending upon team dynamics, strategy and requirements one can find suitable batsman for any situation
source.eb249d39: There is another metric that analyzes batsman on the basis of percentage of balls resulting in 4 or 6
